title_sort: walt whitman to herbert gilchrist, 15 april 1883
title: Walt Whitman to Herbert Gilchrist, 15 April 1883
text: Kirkwood (Glendale) AmericaApril 15 '83I am down here for a few days—Mrs. S.Stafford has had a severe fit of illness—three weeks—one week quite alarming—but is now better—to day—is up—& has been down stairs once or twice for a few minutes—with luck & good weather the doctor thinks she will get around again as usual before long—Nothing specially new with me—I keep about as usual—have had a fair winter—Dr Bucke's book is being printed & is to have your intaglio for a frontispiece—it arouses the strongest opinions pro and con—(Dr B. & several,—including myself,—decidedly like it)Love to you, to your dear M.Mother & to GGrace.W W Walt Whitman to Herbert Gilchrist, 15 April 1883
